ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Data file 1
type of data file 1
data file 1 category
Notes: HRV=heart rate variability daily data file per participant; Annotation=Corresponding annotation file with metadata information

ElementDescription: Start date
End date
Sleep Minutes in the main HDCZA SPT-window
Wake Minutes in the main HDCZA SPT-window
Total Sleep Minutes in the main HDCZA SPT-window
Duration of the main HDCZA SPT-window, noon-noon (in minutes)
(Sleep Minutes/Sleep Period Duration)*100%
Average of activity in a 24 hours period (in milligravity)
Mean wake episodes, midnight-midnight (in minutes)
Longest Wake Episodes, midnight-midnight (in minutes)
Duration of the main HDCZA SPT-window, noon-noon (in minutes)
Mean sleep episodes in the main HDCZA SPT-window, noon-noon (in minutes)
Longest sleep episode in the main HDCZA SPT-window, noon-noon (in minutes)
The number of awakenings between sleep onset and offset during the sleep period length window
